intro: Rubus schorleri, commonly known as Schörler's blackberry, is a species of bramble native to South America. It belongs to the Rubus genus, which includes many species of shrubs commonly referred to as blackberries or raspberries. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems, trifoliate leaves, and aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is edible and has a flavor similar to other Rubus species, though it is less commonly cultivated.
